Welcome to snakegame’s documentation!¶

This is how users navigate through the program, they click on the

The login page where already registered users can enter their credentials to play the game

The page where new users can register their information

The page where users can pick the color of the snake they want/the game mode that they want to play

The game board where the game is played, the snake is controlled using arrow keys

The leaderboard page where user's scores are saved

The admin panel where admins can clear the database in case of emergencies

The about page where you can get to know us a bit

mygame.routes.about()¶

loads the about page with information about the developers

mygame.routes.admin()¶

loads the admin panel and sends in a list of users and gives the admins the option to clear users

mygame.routes.adminTOhelp()¶

loads the help page after users are cleared in admin panel

mygame.routes.adminToColor()¶

loads the color/mode picker page after users are cleared in admin panel

mygame.routes.adminToLogin()¶

loads login page after users are cleared in admin panel

mygame.routes.adminToLogout()¶

logs the user out after users are cleared in admin panel

mygame.routes.adminToRegister()¶

loads register page after users are cleared in admin panel

mygame.routes.adminToabout()¶

loads the about page after users are cleared in admin panel

mygame.routes.adminToleaderboard()¶

loads the leaderboard afer users are cleared

mygame.routes.blackgame()¶

loads the game with a black snake body

mygame.routes.clearUsers()¶

creates the clear users functionality in the admin panel

mygame.routes.greengame()¶

loads the game with a green snake body

mygame.routes.hardgame()¶

loads the game hard game mode

mygame.routes.index()¶

loads the clocker/mode picker page if the user is already logged in

mygame.routes.leaderboard()¶

loads the leaderboard when that button is clicked

mygame.routes.login()¶

loads the login page

mygame.routes.logout()¶

logs out the user

mygame.routes.orangegame()¶

loads the game with a orange snake body

mygame.routes.postmethod1()¶

this allows user scores for the normal game modes to be saved in the database also if the current score is the highest score

mygame.routes.postmethod2()¶

this allows user scores for the game mode with the black snake body to be saved in the database also if the current score is the highest score

mygame.routes.postmethod3()¶

this allows user scores for the hard game mode to be saved in the database also if the current score is the highest score

mygame.routes.purplegame()¶

loads the game with a purple snake body

mygame.routes.redgame()¶

loads the game with a red snake body

mygame.routes.register()¶

allows users to register a username, it also checks if the username is unique

class mygame.models.Post(**kwargs)¶
class mygame.models.User(**kwargs)¶
check_password(password)¶

a function for when the password needs to be checked

Parameters

password – the string of the user’s password

set_password(password)¶

sets the password for the user based on what the user entered and hashes it for security

Parameters

password – the string of the user’s password

mygame.models.load_user(id)¶

loads the user if the credentials are right

Parameters

id – id of the user

class mygame.forms.LoginForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

Creates the fields that exist for the login page

class mygame.forms.RegistrationForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

Creates the fields that exist for the register page

validate_username(username)¶

checks if the username is unique
